reviews.review_msg: This prof was excellent! She's very clear about what she wants and is very helpful. She's a fair maker and makes the subject interesting. I definitely recommend her. She tries to vary between lecturing and films, which makes the courses far more interesting.

While I appreciated her intentions, and the course itself - I found the course fairly boring and lacking charecter. Many of the discussions could've been left to a lower level history course, and she teaches little to no historical insight of her own; instead drawing on the ideas of others. Her assignments are fairly easy - just slightly obtuse.

Definitely has her own agenda - she's a real left-winger. She also clearly specializes in and prefers Pacific (namely Asian) to Atlantic migration - she corrected factual 'errors' on my European paper that were right out of a text book. She is indeed a very nice and friendly lady, but has little interest outside of her speciality.

This is an excellent class to take. Andrea was a wonderful instructor who offered organized and clear lectures. If you follow her instructions for assignments it was very easy to get a good grade. She was ALWAYS willing to make time to see you for assignments and questions, and she offers fantastic advice.
Janice is fabulous.  I wish all my profs were so dedicated!

Her expectations are unclear, her lectures tend to go into minute detail on only a few issues, and while her sarcasm is at times humourous, it is sometimes at the student's expense. Very helpful, but prefers to push you in the direction *she* wants you to go, rather than helping you with your own. Overall, unless you love Japanese history - avoid.
